pageContext.description: Very poor condition, the whole of the surface being 'in extremis' of oxidisation, rough with green barnacle-like lumps [obbled?] about on the durface. Top and bottom edge of one flange broken at buttend. No traces of loops. There are traces just distinguishable of three raised ribs below stop-ridge, coverging into one, which runs down the cutting edge thus: [illust.].
pageContext.patina: Thick green patina nearly all over, except in a few spots which are dark brown.
pageContext.site: England, devon,appledore (3 m. north of bideford),"dug up in excavating to make the foundations for a wall."
pageContext.remarks: Originally labelled in Brideford Museum as "Probably date 878 AD" (Date of local battle with Danes)
